The European Union’s Evolving Global Role
The European Union's Evolving Global Role

In the 27 years since the fall of the Berlin Wall, the European Union has sought to develop its international role in multiple ways and address the global void created by the end of the East-West divide. This short course examines the extent to which the EU has – or has not - emerged as a global authority and norm setter by considering a series of contemporary foreign policy areas where the EU has been engaged. The course examines the diversity of EU external policies and raises questions such as - Why does the EU have competences in specific areas? What are the limitations? To what extent can and does the EU “export” its values and norms? We will also consider how the EU’s global authority is viewed by third countries: what is the perception of the EU’s image in the media in Asia, for example? The course also considers some contemporary EU foreign and security issues, including selected case-studies from the more than two dozen EU overseas policing and military missions undertaken since 2003. This focus is contrasted with an examination of the EU’s civilian capacities including development assistance, particularly in Africa, and election monitoring.
Topics in Black World Studies: Exploring the Female Black Narrative
Topics in Black World Studies: Exploring the Female Black Narrative

From the mid-19th century to modern day, a black literary tradition has arisen to expose the often-unarticulated female perspective. Black female narrators such as Zora Neale Hurston, Toni Morrison, Alice Walker, Maya Angelou and the likes began engaging in political, racial and spiritual discourse. Through an exploration of their essays, poetry and fictional works, students will have the opportunity to gain a greater historical understanding of the black, female experience in the US. For example, Alice Walker discusses the positive affect her literature has had on conceptualizing a historically accurate yet fictional account of “womanist” theory and formulations of “blackness”. Likewise, we will reflect on various authors of similar acclaim to make connections between narratives.
Overall, this course serves to explore the legacy first generation African American female writers have had on impacting the manner in which we approach issues of race, gender and class through multiple literary mediums in order to understand contemporary US society.

Visual Cultures and Blackness in Europe

And yet the question that comes to mind is why do we still fear the Other? Organizational Leadership in China and the United States
Organizational Leadership in China and the United States

What does “leadership” mean and how does it work? Answers and ideas vary greatly across cultural and national boundaries. The meaning and practice of 领导 (lingdao) in China is not necessarily the same as the meaning and practice of leadership in the United States. Important differences also exist between leadership, management, and authority. Through lecture, discussion, video examples, this course will explore and compare different understandings and styles of leadership and how they can be effectively expressed in organizational or social settings.
Creativity in Education, Organization, and Life
Creativity in Education, Organization, and Life

Creative thinking and action are increasingly seen as vital to education, economic productivity, social innovation, and harmony among communities and nations. But what does it mean to be creative? Are people “born that way,” or can creativity be taught and learned? Does creativity require years of study and practice, or can anyone express it? How can we identify and evaluate creative works? Through lecture, discussion, video, and other media, this course explores the theory and practice of creativity in the arts, science, technology, education, and leadership.

Murderous Passion, Serene Heart: Buddhist Ethics Today

Using artistic and visual media, this course will introduce the student to the Buddhist conceptions of psychological, spiritual, and moral growth throughout the four seasons of life, from youth to adolescence to adulthood and old age. It will focus on a test case: an artistic portrait of routine life that begins in innocence, irrupts into murderous passion, yet ultimately leads to compassion. Focusing on a single story, this course will survey the foundational ideas and ethical principles of Mahāyāna Buddhism. Then it will critically examine "rival" values from classical and contemporary perspectives.In this course, the student will develop a working vocabulary in Buddhism and ethics and will be able to apply this vocabulary to the world around them.

This course will introduce the student to an array of classicbodhisattva archetypes and their artistic depictions in East Asian Buddhist Traditions. It will explore the nature of archetypes as symbols and how such symbols function in moral education. It will examine the relation between these symbols, the ten basic moral precepts of Mahāyāna Buddhism, and the Noble Eightfold Path. And it will inquire whether these archetypal images can serve us in addressing ethical issues in the contemporary world. This course will rely strongly on visual media. 最优化问题，主要是指以下形式的问题： 给定一个函数f:A→R，寻找一个元素x0∈A，使得对于所有A中的x，f(x0)≤f(x)（最小化）；或者f(x0)≥f(x)（最大化）。这类定式有时还称为“数学规划”（譬如，线性规划）。许多现实和理论问题都可以建模成这样的一般性框架。最优化，是应用数学的一个分支。而机器学习中，最优化问题是一个重要而主要要解决的问题。对应用场景进行建模后，往往就要求出符合要求的最优解，也就是进行最优化。故该学科是该双特生感兴趣、特长领域的一门重要的理论基础学科，是该生在此领域具有长远发展潜力的重要基石。

本课程系统介绍变分分析的基本理论，讨论变分分析在最优化理论与算法分析中所起的基础性作用。变分分析部分包括宇宙空间与锥、集值映射、集合的变分几何、函数的广义微分、单值函数的Lipschitz性质和集值映射的Aubin性质、隐函数定理与系统稳定性。最优化理论部分包括最优性理论（含有Lipschitz函数优化的Clarke乘子原则以及均衡约束数学规划问题的最优性条件）、非线性规划的扰动分析、二阶锥的变分分析与二阶锥约束优化问题的扰动分析，以及半正定矩阵锥的变分分析与半定规划问题的扰动分析。最优化的算法部分包括Newton方法和邻近点方法，邻近点方法部分介绍Moreau包络、等式约束的非线性规划问题、非线性二阶锥约束优化问题与非线性半定规划问题的增广Lagrange方法的收敛速度等。而对于机器学习领域来说，变分分析是进行最优化的强而有力的工具。故该学科是该双特生感兴趣、特长领域的一门重要的理论基础学科，是该生在此领域具有长远发展潜力的重要基石。

在机器学习和相关领域，人工神经网络（人工神经网络）的计算模型灵感来自动物的中枢神经系统（尤其是脑），并且被用于估计或可以依赖于大量的输入和一般的未知近似函数。人工神经网络通常呈现为相互连接的“神经元”，它可以从输入的计算值，并且能够机器学习以及模式识别由于它们的自适应性质的系统。而现在热门发展的深度学习源于人工神经网络的研究，含多隐层的多层感知器就是一种深度学习结构。深度学习通过组合低层特征形成更加抽象的高层表示属性类别或特征，以发现数据的分布式特征表示。是各个研究领域的强有力的工具。故该生通过学习此课程，不但可以了解神经网络与机器学习，为后续科研训练创造条件，而且可以接触科研的前沿，为将来参与创新性的研究和开发工作打下坚实的基础。
神经网络是计算智能和机器学习的重要分支，它是由众多的神经元可调的连接权值连接而成，具有大规模并行处理、分布式信息存储、良好的自组织自学习能力等特点。在诸多领域都取得了很大的成功。本课程主要介绍神经网络与机器学习。

近代中国的思想与文化发生了几千年未有之巨变。传统思想体系解体，各种主义纷至沓来，各种传统与现代的思想因子打散重组，呈现出古今中外混杂纷呈的复杂局面。本课程旨在将近代中国的主要思潮放置入社会转型变迁之中，启发学生思考思想如何转动社会以及社会如何在实践中衍生思想，在思想与社会的互构中揭示近代中国的巨大变迁。
